item.title: [YESBANK] YES Bank Re-appoints Dr. Rajan Pental as Executive Director till July 2026
item.description:
YES Bank Ltd has received approval from the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) for the re-appointment of Dr. Rajan Pental as Executive Director for a further period of six months, effective from February 2, 2026, until his superannuation date, July 31, 2026. His re-appointment is subject to the approval of the bank's shareholders. Dr. Pental has a rich experience of 3 decades in the financial services industry and currently serves as the Executive Director at YES BANK, overseeing various portfolios including Branch Banking, Retail Assets, SME Banking, and Corporate Social Responsibility. He has been instrumental in setting up and institutionalizing the Retail Assets Business for HDFC Bank in the Northern region and has held positions of increasing responsibilities in HDFC Bank from Jun 2001 to Oct 2015.

  • YES Bank receives RBI approval for Dr. Rajan Pental's re-appointment as Executive Director.
  • Dr. Pental's re-appointment is effective from February 2, 2026, until July 31, 2026.
  • His re-appointment is subject to shareholder approval.
  • Dr. Pental has 3 decades of experience in the financial services industry.
  • He currently oversees various portfolios at YES BANK and has a proven track record in Retail Banking and building new businesses.

item.title: [LEMONTREE] Lemon Tree Hotels Announces Composite Scheme of Arrangement
item.description:
Lemon Tree Hotels Limited, a leading hotel chain in India, has announced a Composite Scheme of Arrangement. This scheme will result in two distinct businesses: Lemon Tree Hotels, a pure-play asset-light company, and Fleur Hotels, a large-scale hotel ownership/leasing platform. The reorganization is expected to be completed in 12-15 months. Post reorganization, Lemon Tree will be debt-free, high-margin, and high ROCE, generating strong free cash flows. Fleur Hotels will consolidate ownership of existing hotels and pursue growth through development, acquisitions, and enhancing asset level performance.

  • Lemon Tree Hotels to become a pure-play asset-light company focused on hotel management, brand, loyalty distribution, and digital services.
  • Fleur Hotels to operate as a large-scale hotel ownership/leasing platform with end-to-end in-house development capabilities.
  • Post reorganization, Lemon Tree will be debt-free, high-margin, and high ROCE, generating strong free cash flows.
  • Fleur Hotels will consolidate ownership of existing hotels and pursue growth through development, acquisitions, and enhancing asset level performance.
  • The reorganization is expected to be completed in 12-15 months.

item.title: [CUPID] Cupid Ltd to Invest Rs. 331 Crores in Baazar Style Retail Ltd; Expanding FMCG Product Portfolio and Consumer Reach
item.description:
ðŸ”¥ Trending

Cupid Limited has informed BSE about the outcome of its Board Meeting held on 21st January, 2026. The Board approved a strategic investment in Preferential Warrants Convertible in to Equity Shares of Baazar Style Retail Limited, a company listed on BSE Limited and National Stock Exchange of India, amounting to Rs. 331,53,25,000 (Rupees Three Hundred and Thirty-one Crores Fifty-Three Lakhs and Twenty-five Thousand only). This investment will provide Cupid's FMCG product portfolio with a strong platform to scale across key regional markets, with the store network expected to expand to over 500 locations within the next 3 years. The preferential warrants will be converted into equity shares within the timelines as per ICDR regulations, 2018, with 25% of the issue amount paid at the time of allotment and the balance 75% at the time of exercise of the right of conversion.

  • Cupid Limited to invest Rs. 331 Crores in Baazar Style Retail Limited
  • Strategic investment to strengthen Cupid's retail presence and expand consumer reach
  • Baazar Style Retail Limited operates over 250 stores and aims to expand to 500 locations within the next 3 years
  • Cupid's FMCG product portfolio will be an integral part of the store network's growth
  • Preferential warrants to be converted into equity shares within the timelines as per ICDR regulations, 2018
